name: Medial (ulnar) collateral ligament — anterior band
text: Medial (ulnar) collateral ligament (UCL), anterior band. Attachments: anteroinferior medial epicondyle of humerus to sublime tubercle of ulna (~18 mm distal to coronoid tip). Function: strongest elbow ligament; primary restraint to valgus stress. Tension pattern: taut from ~60° flexion to full extension. Clinical: reconstructed in UCL reconstruction (Tommy John surgery).

tension.note: taut from ~60° flexion to full extension

measurement_mm.context: sublime_tubercle ~18 mm distal to coronoid tip

name: Medial (ulnar) collateral ligament — posterior band
text: Medial (ulnar) collateral ligament (UCL), posterior band. Function: contributes to valgus stability (secondary). Tension pattern: taut from ~60° to 120° of elbow flexion; demonstrates the greatest change in length from flexion to extension.

tension.note: taut from ~60° to 120° of flexion; greatest length change across flexion-extension

name: Medial (ulnar) collateral ligament — transverse band
text: Medial (ulnar) collateral ligament (UCL), transverse band (Cooper ligament). Function: spans ulna-to-ulna (does not cross the humeroulnar joint) and provides limited contribution to valgus stability compared with anterior band.

name: Lateral collateral ligament complex — lateral ulnar collateral ligament
text: Lateral collateral ligament (LCL) complex — lateral ulnar collateral ligament (LUCL). Attachments: lateral epicondyle of humerus to supinator crest of ulna. Function: key stabilizer against posterolateral rotatory instability (PLRI); deficiency leads to PLRI.

name: Lateral collateral ligament complex — annular ligament
text: Lateral collateral ligament (LCL) complex — annular ligament. Function: stabilizes the proximal radioulnar joint by encircling the radial head and maintaining its position against the ulna.

name: Lateral collateral ligament complex — quadrate ligament
text: Lateral collateral ligament (LCL) complex — quadrate ligament. Function: supports the proximal radioulnar joint; runs from annular ligament region to the radial neck.

name: Lateral collateral ligament complex — oblique cord
text: Lateral collateral ligament (LCL) complex — oblique cord. Function: fibrous band connecting radius and ulna in the proximal forearm; contributes to longitudinal stability and resists distraction forces.
